channel.title: Redash storage exploded, old queries results not being removed?
channel.description:
### Issue Summary
Hello,
So, unexpectedly my EC2 instance with redash gave me an error and it looked like redash used 100% of its storage space. How can I check if old queries are not being deleted? Also, the query refresh schedule also affects the storage? I.e. run query every 5 min versus once a day? What can I do to prevent all that?
### Technical details:
* Redash Version:10.1 * Browser/OS: Chrome/Windows * How did you install Redash: self-hosted as EC2 instance on AWS

Issue Summary

Hello,

So, unexpectedly my EC2 instance with redash gave me an error and it looked like redash used 100% of its storage space. How can I check if old queries are not being deleted? Also, the query refresh schedule also affects the storage? I.e. run query every 5 min versus once a day? What can I do to prevent all that?
